net.sourceforge.gxl
Class GXLRelend

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLElement
        |
        +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLAttributedElement
              |
              +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLRelend
All Implemented Interfaces:
GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
public class GXLRelend
extends GXLAttributedElement
implements GXLLocalConnectionTentacle

Represents the GXL relend element.

The relend element represents a tentacle of a relation, defining the graph elements that are contained in the relation.

Observe that the relend element DOES NOT allow the id attribute even though it's a subclass of GXLAttributedElement which defines a method for setting the id. This is an ambiguity between the gxl graph schema (which states that all attributed elements contains id attributes) and the gxl dtd which contradicts this.

Children
GXLAttr - Attributes describing this relation tentacle.

Attributes
target - Required id referencing the target graph element of this relend.
role - Optional string describing the function of this relend.
direction - Optional enumeration describing the direction of this tentacle. Possible values are in (INto the relation), out and none. Note that if the surrounding relation is directed, this attribute MUST be set to either in or out. startorder - Optional integer that describes an ordering of the incident relends of the surrounding relation.
endorder - Optional integer that describes an ordering of the incident tentacles of the target element.

See Also:
GXLLocalConnectionTentacle, GXLRel, GXLGraphElement

getTarget

public GXLGraphElement getTarget()
Returns the GXLGraphElement that this relend connects to. Note that this method will return null if this tentacle is dangling.

Specified by:
getTarget in interface GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
Returns:
The GXLGraphElement that this relend connects to.
See Also:
getTargetID()

setTarget

public void setTarget(GXLGraphElement target)
Sets the GXLGraphElement that this relend connects to. Note that only the graph elements id is stored, and that changing that id prior to insertion into a GXLDocument will cause this tentacle to become dangling.

Specified by:
setTarget in interface GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
Parameters:
target - The GXLGraphElement that this tentacle should connect to.
Throws:
GXLValidationException - If this action would result in an invalid GXL document.

getDirection

public String getDirection()
The direction of this tentacle, either GXL.NONE, GXL.IN or GXL.OUT. A convenience method to disclose the direction of this tentacle, either GXL.NONE (undirected), GXL.IN (from the target element into the edge) or GXL.OUT (from the edge to the target element).

Specified by:
getDirection in interface GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
Returns:
The direction of this tentacle, either GXL.NONE, GXL.IN or GXL.OUT.

Parameters:

Throws:
GXLValidationException - If this action would result in an invalid GXL document.

hasRelIncidenceOrder

public boolean hasRelIncidenceOrder()
Whether this relend is ordered relative to the surrounding relations other relends.

Returns:
Whether this relend is ordered relative to the surrounding relations other relends.

getRelIncidenceOrder

public int getRelIncidenceOrder()
Returns the order of this relend. Note that the value returned by this method is only valid if hasRelIncidenceOrder() returns true. Also note that the integer returned by this method is used relative to the other relends incident to the relation and shouldn't be treated as an absolute value. As an example, negative values are allowed.

Returns:
The order of this relend.

setRelIncidenceOrder

public void setRelIncidenceOrder(int order)
Sets the order of this relend. Note that (1) that the order value must be unqiue troughtout all relends of the relation and (2) that the order is used relative the other relends order values.

Parameters:
order - The integer that is used relatively to define an order of the relations relends.
Throws:
GXLValidationException - If this action would result in an invalid GXL document.

getTargetIncidenceOrder

public int getTargetIncidenceOrder()
Returns the order of this tentacle. Note that the value returned by this method is only valid if hasTargetIncidenceOrder() returns true. Also note that the integer returned by this method is used relative to the other tentacles incident to the target element and shouldn't be treated as an absolute value. As an example, negative values are allowed.

Specified by:
getTargetIncidenceOrder in interface GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
Returns:
The order of this tentacle.

setTargetIncidenceOrder

public void setTargetIncidenceOrder(int order)
Sets the order of this tentacle. Note that (1) that the order value must be unqiue troughtout all incident tentacles of the target and (2) that the order is used relatively the other tentacles order value.

Specified by:
setTargetIncidenceOrder in interface GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
Parameters:
order - The integer that is used relatively to define an order of the targets incident tentacles.
Throws:
GXLValidationException - If this action would result in an invalid GXL document.

isDangling

public boolean isDangling()
Returns whether this tentacle is dangling. A tentacle is considered dangling if the target cannot be found because of (1) the GXLDocument that this tentacle is contained in doesn't contain an element with the specified target id, or (2) if this tentacle isn't contained in a GXLDocument.

Specified by:
isDangling in interface GXLLocalConnectionTentacle
Returns:
Whether this tentacle is dangling.
